intro: Pleurothallis florulenta, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact, sympodial growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and slightly hairy, contributing to its overall ornamental appeal. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a valued species in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
